radiographic_examinations.findings: Two small ill-defined opacities at both lung apexes.
Dilatation of the intrahepatic and extrahepatic ducts; enlargement of the pancreatic head; complex cystic masses adjacent to the pancreatic head and tail; low-density splenic lesion.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Stent in place with decreased bile-duct dilatation and the pancreatic head mass slightly decreased in size. The complex cystic mass in the head of the pancreas had decreased in size.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Diffusely dilated biliary tree above a localized stenosis of the middle third of the common bile duct.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Persistent stricture of the middle third of the main bile duct, with a patent sphincterotomy.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Confirmed dilated intrahepatic and extrahepatic bile ducts and a complex cystic mass in the pancreatic head.

radiographic_examinations.date: Approximately two months after the first scan
radiographic_examinations.findings: No residual intrahepatic biliary dilatation; cystic mass in the head of the pancreas almost fully resolved; multiple enlarged retroperitoneal lymph nodes developed.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement in cystic mass and reduction in biliary dilatation.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Unchanged mass in the porta hepatis and decrease in the size of the pancreatic-head mass.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The pancreatic head mass decreased in size.
